title: Looking for a clarendon similar to rubber stamp alphabet set
content:
this sample shows the impressions made from a rubber stamp alphabet set— i believe it is based on an antique clarendon font— can anyone tell me where i can find it?

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/72817927@N00/369114046/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032050/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/72817927@N00/369114046/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/72817927@N00/369114046/")

thanks for your help—

cindy
author: ephemerist

comments.content: If you want a similar finish you might really enjoy [LTR Salmiak](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032050/http:/www.letterror.com/catalog/salmiak/index.html) or one of the fonts from these [hand drawn serifs](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032050/http:/typographi.com/000737.php).

The numbers remind me of the [Psy/Ops Crash Numbering Kit](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032050/http:/www.psyops.com/html/library_crash.html) (which is free).

- Lex
If you want it to look antiqued, see Keith Bates’ [Mailart Rubberstamp](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032050/http:/www.k-type.com/fontmar.html).
